availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin J. Gossett (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Atkinson Gossett. Father of John M. Gossett, Sarah C. Gossett, Levi Gossett, and Lucy Gossett. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Bath County 1850. Owned Dilly [Unknown] in Bath County in 1858. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Bath County 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 112A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 173.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 28.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994028, Bath County Births.
"Martin J. Gossett (1817-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial 30610404, accessed July 8, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30610404.
